Fruit-walls improved, by inclining them to the horizon, or, A way to build walls for fruit-trees whereby they may receive more sun shine, and heat, than ordinary / by a member of the Royal Society. Fatio de Duillier, Nicolas, 1664-1753.
xxviii, [2], 128 p., 2 leaves of plates (folded) : ill.
Printed by R. Everingham, London : 1699.
Attributed to Nicolas Fatio de Duillier. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). Reproduction of original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

xxviii, [2], 128 p., 2 leaves of plates (folded) : ill.
Printed by R. Everingham, London : 1699.
